text: This is quite the mind warp: <https://evrone.com/bauman-mstu-course>

attachments.title: Evrone partners with Bauman Moscow State Technical University to teach biomedical programming.
attachments.text: Bauman Moscow State Technical University has invited Evrone’s specialists to teach the “Algorithmization and Programming” course for students of the Faculty of Biomedical Engineering. We teach freshmen to write and understand code and use it to solve scientific and technological challenges.
attachments.fallback: Evrone partners with Bauman Moscow State Technical University to teach biomedical programming.

elements.text: This is quite the mind warp:

text: I wouldn't have guessed Bauman to be a Russian name

elements.text: I wouldn't have guessed Bauman to be a Russian name

text: Solidly German

elements.text: Solidly German

text: But was named for <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikolay_Bauman>

attachments.title: Nikolay Bauman
attachments.text: Nikolay Ernestovich Bauman (Russian: Никола́й Эрне́стович Ба́уман, romanized: Nikoláy Ernéstovich Báuman) (May 29 [O.S. May 17] 1873 – October 31 [O.S. October 18] 1905) was a professional Russian revolutionary of the Bolshevik Party.His death in a struggle with a royalist upon his release from Taganka Prison in 1905 made him one of the first martyrs of the Revolution, and later the Soviet Union.

elements.text: But was named for

text:
but sure enough:

text: My father was a Eugene.  For a long time, there were two Eugene Jones at the Oklahoma State University Veterinary School, my father Eugene M. Jones, and his friend (from Wales) Eugene W. Jones. :slightly_smiling_face:

text:
My father was stationed in Tulsa at the end of WWII (after serving in the Panama Canal Zone on submarine watches), made good friends with a vet and his family there.
Went to Cornell on the GI bill, got DVM degree, then went back to Tulsa, worked for his friend until my parents started their own practice in Midwest City. That grew to be the largest small animal practice in the state, before they sold it and he became head of the small animal faculty of the OSU Vet School.
If your grandfather was a vet in the 40s-60s in the state, I’m sure they knew each other, it was not a huge community!

elements.text: My father was stationed in Tulsa at the end of WWII (after serving in the Panama Canal Zone on submarine watches), made good friends with a vet and his family there.

Went to Cornell on the GI bill, got DVM degree, then went back to Tulsa, worked for his friend until my parents started their own practice in Midwest City. That grew to be the largest small animal practice in the state, before they sold it and he became head of the small animal faculty of the OSU Vet School.
If your grandfather was a vet in the 40s-60s in the state, I’m sure they knew each other, it was not a huge community!

text: I think about all the wonderful Julians I’ve met, online and in-person, all around the world. It still feels like a small, tight community, even though it’s growing by leaps and bounds.
